Translations.Text: Does he not know when the tombs are exposed
and what is in the breasts is brought to light
Verily, thy Lord upon that day indeed is well aware
The smiting
What is the smiting
And what shall make thee know what the smiting is
The day when men shall be like scattered moths
and the mountains shall be like flocks of carded wool
And as for him whose balance is heavy
he shall be in a well-pleasing life
But as for him whose balance is light
his dwelling shall be the pit of hell
And who shall make thee know what it is
a burning fire
The contention about numbers deludes you
till ye visit the tombs
Not so! In the end ye shall know
And again not so! In the end ye shall know
Not so! Did ye but know with certain knowledge
Ye shall surely see hell
And again ye shall surely see it with an eye of certainty
Then ye shall surely be asked about pleasure
By the afternoon
verily, man is in loss
save those who believe and do right, and bid each other be true, and bid each other be patient
Woe to every slanderous backbiter
who collects wealth and counts it
He thinks that his wealth can immortalize him
Not so! he shall be hurled into ElHutamah
And what shall make thee understand what ElHutamah is
the fire of God kindled
which rises above the hearts
Verily, it is an archway over them
on long-drawn columns
Hast thou not seen what thy Lord did with the fellows of the elephant
Did He not make their stratagem lead them astray
and send down on them birds in flocks
to throw down on them stones of baked clay
and make them like blades of herbage eaten down
For the uniting of the Qurais
uniting them for the caravan of winter and summer
So let them serve the Lord of this house
who feeds them against hunger and makes them safe against fear
Hast thou considered him who calls the judgment a lie
He it is who pushes the orphan away
and urges not (others) to feed the poor
But woe to those who pray
and who are careless in their prayers
Who pretend
and withhold necessaries
Verily, we have given thee El Kauthar
So pray to thy Lord and slaughter (victims)
Verily, he who hates thee shall be childless
Say, O ye misbelievers
I do not serve what ye serve
nor will ye serve what I serve
nor will I serve what ye serve
nor will ye serve what I serve
ye have your religion, and I have my religion
When there comes God's help and victory
And thou shalt see men enter into God's religion by troops
Then celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and ask forgiveness of Him, verily, He is relentant
Abu Lahebs two hands shall perish, and he shall perish
His wealth shall not avail him, nor what he has earned
He shall broil in a fire that flames
and his wife carrying faggots
on her neck a cord of palm fibres
Say, He is God alone
God the Eternal
He begets not and is not begotten
Nor is there like unto Him any one
Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of the daybreak
from the evil of what He has created
and from the evil of the night when it cometh on
and from the evil of the blowers upon knots
and from the evil of the envious when he envies
Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of men
the King of men
the God of men
from the evil of the whisperer, who slinks off
who whispers into the hearts of men
from ginns and men
